explanation: The outer loop used range(n) but the inner loop adds s[l+i] for l in 0..6. When i > n-7 this accesses past the end of s and raises an IndexError. I changed the outer loop to iterate only over valid start indices for 7-element windows: range(n-6), so s[l+i] stays in bounds.
fixed_code:
n = int(input())
s = list(map(int,input().split()))

for i in range(n-6):
  ans = 0
  for l in range(7):
    ans += s[l+i]

  print(str(ans),"",end = "")
